text: <@U066B6F9R> no I don’t think there’s a pydata/scipy group - but there is the PyHou group, and the Houston Energy Data Science group
Yes <@U061A5N1G> . One of the 3 groups can fill the vacuum or maybe a 4th one
Yeah the truth is the PyHou group tends to stay focused on topics that apply broadly to people using the python language for a range of things
The past two meetups discussed Metaclasses, and Unit Testing, respectively. But the one before that talked about Data Analysis in python
There is an article on Forbes that shows the vacuum. Prefix, uptkae and now parstream are rushing
Just looked up Predix - looks pretty cool!
I used predix they have work left to do. First one wins big
